The best asometric horror game money can buy is Dead By Daylight and if you don't believe me you clearly haven't played it. You either play as one of a group of four survivors or you be their stalker, some of the killers in this game are familiar faces being horror movies characters, and a cast of fresh original terrifying characters. 

Survivor 
as the survivor you goal is to basically just survive and evade the killer while repairing 5 generators spread across the randomly selected map. Every match you load into the generator spots move but general map knowledge still exists so much so knowing the map will determine how skilled you are at the game so make sure to play alot and learn the maps. Running away from the killer can sometimes seem futile but items such as pallets, window frames, bushes etc. can help you get an edge on the killer. (you are in third person and the killer can only see in first)

Killer 
Killer is pretty simple really just kill the survivors before they repair all their generators when one final survivor is remaing however a hatch on the map will open allowing this survivor to escape even if they have not completed all generators. However the hatch can be kicked shut if you can find it before them.
LOVE THIS GAME

They broke solo queue (playing survivor alone) with the latest patch, and I'm pretty sure they either turned off MMR or it just never did anything anyway. It has never been more difficult to survive a game as a solo queue survivor, let alone finish 5 generators, and devs came out and said they're not doing anything about it until at least 2023. Solo queue survivors still have no means of communication with each other, and taking 2 weeks to implement a basic communication wheel is somehow out of the question.

Killers getting 3-5 hooks before the first generator is done is now the standard, and it's not uncommon to find yourself in games with people who have 20-50 hours played. I have near 1000 but these people are ending up in my games when they shouldn't. 

I'm done with survivor. I'm going to grind out the seasonal Rift with killer and then uninstall the game for a few months. I don't think I could ever recommend this game to new players. There's still no practice mode beyond the awful tutorial, which has 1 locked killer, and 4 locked survivors, all of whom cannot use perks, items, or addons. It's also locked to the same map. Until they institute a customizable solo practice mode, I will never recommend this game to new players. Now that solo queue is essentially hard mode, it's not even worth your time anyway.

On the other hand, it's never been easier to learn killer, and get a perfect game at the same time..

(Edited) I think most people will have a love/hate relationship with this game, the community is what you should be wary of when playing this as most of the them are very toxic and can really upset some people and their mental health even though Dead By Daylight is quite addicting. 

Best advice I can give is play/practice with friends, try and not go into a match with high expectations of the outcome or other players, ignore what some players will say to you and bite your lip when the developers make mistakes. 

Though the devs make a lot of mistakes, their story-telling for their characters and world is really well done and I think instead of just seeing this as a game, we should really enjoy the characters we have to draw fanart and write fanfiction for!
This game is the most toxic piece of shit I have ever played, but it keeps bringing me back. Every. Single. Time.

Before you buy this game consider whether you wanna play against the small group of people that are playing this game. The game doesn't have a big fan base so you mostly play against people far from your rank because the devs can't fix the game. So for example let's say you are new to the game you play as a killer that you just got, you have unlocked 3 perks and are having a great time, then you rank up one rank and suddenly you play against the highest rank with 4 perks lvl 3 nothing you can do.

El juego al principio es adictivo y te engancha bastante, a primeras mi opinión después de 2-3 años jugándolo es que cada vez ha ido a peor, solo se centran en sacar nuevo personaje + mapa, cada vez que meten parche crean tropecientos bugs, la comunidad es muy tóxica, de las peores (gracias que no tiene chat de voz).

El ultimo personaje como balanceo es practicamente una mierda.

En resumen: después de mas de 2mil horas entre diferentes cuentas no recomiendo este juego ya que a los desarrolladores les importa más el dinero que la jugabilidad en si.
Muito bom mesmo depois de anos.
